intro: Peucedanum syriacum, commonly known as Syrian cowparsley, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes many aromatic herbs and vegetables. The plant features slender stems and compound leaves with a distinctive, fern-like appearance. Its small, yellowish-green flowers are arranged in umbels, typical of the family. The seeds are small and can be used in traditional medicine for their purported health benefits.
